body_html:
There is no standard mechanism for this.

Typically you would either (manually) install your custom ops library in a well-defined place and put that directory on your LD_LIBRARY_PATH, or add . to your path if you want to live dangerously.

I normally add the bazel-bin directory where I built the ops library to my path,
e.g export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/path/to/tensorflow-tree/bazel-bin/tensorflow/core/user_ops

I'm closing this issue now since the reported problem was just a typo.

body:
There is no standard mechanism for this.

Typically you would either (manually) install your custom ops library in a well-defined place and put that directory on your LD_LIBRARY_PATH, or add `.` to your path if you want to live dangerously.

I normally add the bazel-bin directory where I built the ops library to my path, 
e.g `export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/path/to/tensorflow-tree/bazel-bin/tensorflow/core/user_ops`

I'm closing this issue now since the reported problem was just a typo.
